article_title: Neighborhood Involvement Program providing referrals after shutting down all direct services

article_metadata.description: Though she said she and her colleagues at Neighborhood Involvement Program (N.I.P.), the 47-year-old Minneapolis health clinic for the uninsured, “tried their hardest” to keep their mental health programs alive, in late December Patsy Bartley, program CEO/president, had to announce that N.I.P.’s Counseling Center would be shut down effective Dec.

og.description: Staff found homes for many of NIP's services with new partners, including Cornerstone Advocacy Service.
og.title: Neighborhood Involvement Program providing referrals after shutting down all direct services
